metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10517 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
networking.c in Redis before 3.2.7 allows "Cross Protocol Scripting" because it lacks a check for POST and Host: strings, which are not valid in the Redis protocol (but commonly occur when an attack triggers an HTTP request to the Redis TCP port). It was discovered that Redis incorrectly handled certain HTTP POST requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute a Cross Protocol Scripting (CAS) attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10517` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis-server - 2:2.8.4-2ubuntu0.2
redis-tools - 2:2.8.4-2ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: redis package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:2.8.4-2ubuntu0.2').
